definitions.definition: To reestablish, or bring back into existence.
definitions.example: He restored my lost faith in him by doing a good deed.

definitions.definition: To bring back to good condition from a state of decay or ruin.
To give or bring back (that which has been lost or taken); to bring back to the owner; to replace.
To give in place of, or as restitution for.
To recover (data, etc.) from a backup.
definitions.example: There was a crash last night, and we're still restoring the file system.

definitions.definition: To bring (a note) back to its original signification.
To make good; to make amends for.
Pertaining to something or someone renewed or rebuilt.
definitions.example: A fully restored Volkswagen Beetle will cost more.
